programmes.show_description: Dance of the Scorpions: Detective drama series. Det Supt Wycliffe clashes with his superiors over his handling of a double murder investigation. Ep1
Gardening Time: Sitcom about a bus driver and his conductor pal. The inspector and Jack are the only contestants in a gardening competition.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
The Last Rites: The body of a church cleaner is discovered spreadeagled below the Cross. A satanic cult is thought to be behind the killing, but Wycliffe has other suspicions.
The Pea Green Boat: Drama series about a Cornish police detective. Plenty of suspects surface when a fishing boat explodes, killing the owner.
The Point of Vanishing: When religious fanatic Steven Mullan is murdered, Lewis investigates celebrity atheist Tom Rattenbury and his family, who had been attacked by Mullan.
Quartet: A death at an international sporting event leads Endeavour to investigate more than a crime, and Thursday continues to delve into the underworld activity of Oxford.
The Apple Doesn't Fall: Comedy-drama series. Martin is worried that Louisa might have anaemia, and a mother has problems with a daughter who is causing all sorts of trouble.
Movement: Comedy-drama series. When Martin encourages Bert to give up plumbing and open a restaurant, his opening night coincides with a sudden bout of suspected food poisoning.
The Memory of Water: Light-hearted drama series. Rosemary and Laura are working on a walled garden when events take a mysterious turn after their client's cousin is found drowned.
The Rule of Three: Detective drama series. The dead body of a woman who has been missing for over 35 years leads the pair to uncover the dark heart of one of Bath's richest families.
Greenshaw's Folly: Miss Marple helps a friend seek refuge at Greenshaw's Folly. But a shadow soon begins to fall over the various inhabitants living there.
Things That Go Bump in the Night: The murder of an undertaker takes Barnaby and Scott to a village where residents are divided about the rights and wrongs of a spiritualist church.
Home: Quiet life in suburbia takes a dark turn when a woman is found murdered in her garden, and DCI Vera Stanhope discovers that the neighbours aren't all that they seem...
Drama based on real events. Jane Andrews' life changes overnight when she lands a dream job in Buckingham Palace and bonds with the Duchess of York.
Drama based on real events. Jane Andrews' life changes overnight when she lands a dream job in Buckingham Palace and bonds with the Duchess of York.
The Inspector's Niece: Enduring '70s British sitcom about a chirpy bus driver. When a beautiful young woman begins training at the depot, nobody realises that she is Blakey's niece.
Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.
Shopping from home.
Never Say Die: Classic British sitcom. Confusion arises when Simon has to go into hospital.
Foggy Night: Enduring '70s sitcom about a chirpy bus driver and his conductor. Stan has to pull off the road when freezing fog blankets the Home Counties and makes visibility nil.
Hilary decides to leave the village after Laurel tells her she doesn't want baby Arthur in her life. Gennie and her mother bump into a drunken Shadrach.
Gennie explains to Paddy why she snubbed Shadrach. Laurel is horrified to learn the villagers know about the baby swap, and Donna tells Viv there has been no news on Freddie.
A disillusioned Ryan decides he wants to move out and asks Liam if he can stay with him. Jamie gets a job in London and David's jealousy drives Tina away.
Violet takes advantage of the leap year and pops the question to Jamie, while David hopes to prove his love for Tina by getting her name tattooed on his arm.
No Refuge: Detective drama series. After four robberies in four days at the same house, Frost comes up with a surprising arrest as a result of lateral thinking.
Bully Boys: Younger questions his own abilities when he attends a local disturbance, and the police launch a dubious investigation into a former convict who is now a debt collector.
It Came from Outer Space: When an explosion starts rumours that a meteorite has crashed in Aidensfield, Miller and Rachel have other ideas and Joe goes undercover to find out more.
Judgement Day: Rural police drama. When a thief is stabbed to death with a pitchfork and two villagers are murdered, DI Tom Barnaby has to find the killer before they strike again.
Gennie introduces Shadrach to her mother as her biological father. Val bars the Dingles from the Woolpack and Viv creates a wanted poster to help her find Freddie.
Bob worries when Viv starts having nightmares about Freddie. Gennie and her mother visit Shadrach, and Katie is disappointed with the turnout for her engagement party.
Following a tip-off from Lauren, an incredulous Sean races to stop Violet and Jamie leaving with baby Dylan, while Tina shows her disgust for David's declaration of love.
Gail warns Tina about messing with David, but the girl delivers shocking news. Michelle is reluctant to let Alex leave The Rovers, and Sean realises he may never see his son again.
You Never Can Tell: Foul play is suspected when an ageing pop manager dies after returning to the village to marry a young starlet, and Peggy experiences a spell of memory loss.
Mixed Messages: Carol turns to Joe for help when a pensioner she has been visiting regularly dies unexpectedly and suspicions are aroused, and Gina's pregnancy approaches full term.
The Blacktrees Prophecy: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a plot that reveals how far people will go to escape the end of the world.
Deguello: The murder of an Oxford librarian and a local tragedy test Endeavour and the team to their limits, as they uncover the truth behind the crime that has haunted them all.
